review: This is the best way to go for watching tv. Add on Amazon Prime, Netflix and Hulu+ and there is no other way to watch tv!
author: Vicki Noth "Star Wars Fan!"

review: I used to have trouble downloading Amazon content as well as other services like Netflix and Hulu Plus with the smart apps installed in my TV. I learned from my cable technician that the installed smart apps have a slower processor. Since I have bought and installed the Amazon Fire box to my TV I haven't had those problems and it works pretty smoothly with little or no trouble. I highly recommend one of these, especially if you are like me and have a lot of instant streaming content to download with a Prime Account.
author: Keri Teach "Seaviewkat"

review: Love the ease of use and the voice control search never lets us down..highly recommended!
author: kathy

review: 99.9% of the movies I have considered downloading are "B" movies or ones that I have already seen. Ones that are current, out in the last year can't be watched without renting or buying them. It's probably me but I cannot get my tv on the Internet. Went through the prompts online and it shows me being connected but I can't go any further. This $99 investment was a poor choice and so is Amazon Prime. Won't be renewing that either, after my 30 day trial expires. Would not recommend this product to anyone, even if it's free.

review: One of my best purchases in years.  I am using the Fire TV to supplement and reduce my cable service and its so much nicer.  Its only been a week, and I have been able to find a ton of accessible content within my prime membership.  Lightning fast compare to video game connections.  The only bad news is that my 4 year old daughter seems to take it over with her shows...at least until 9 before i get control.
